Description: Body sherd of Attic black-figured pottery band-cup; interior glazed black; exterior: trace of black lip at top of sherd; below in handle zone, black-figure decoration consisting of confronting bull and panther (of bull, head, neck with added red, shoulder and forelegs remaining; of panther, top of head, rump and one hind leg missing; red on neck); glazed below with a reserved band.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by University College London. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 410-1, no. B627, pl. CCIV)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.1385) (phase 3)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: UCL np 14 (Other Accession Number)
